intro: Corispermum bracteatum, commonly known as the bracteate bladderwrack, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It is a member of the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its adaptations to cold and harsh environments make it an important component of tundra ecosystems.
